description: A comprehensive personal finance management application built with vanilla HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Track income/expenses, set budgets, create savings goals, and visualize financial health through interactive charts.

userStories.title: Project Setup
userStories.description: As a developer, I need the foundational project structure so that I can build the finance dashboard with proper organization.
acceptanceCriteria: Create index.html with semantic HTML5 structure (header, main, footer, nav)
Create styles.css with CSS variables for theming (mint green/teal: primary #3EB489, secondary #E0F7FA)
Create scripts/app.js using module pattern (IIFE or ES6 modules)
Include Chart.js via CDN link in index.html
Page loads without console errors
Verify in browser: blank page loads, no console errors

userStories.title: Header and Navigation
userStories.description: As a user, I want a clear header and navigation so that I can easily switch between different sections of the app.
acceptanceCriteria: App title 'Finance Dashboard' displayed prominently in header
Navigation tabs: Dashboard, Transactions, Budgets, Goals (horizontal layout)
'Add Transaction' button in top right corner with prominent styling (primary color)
Dark mode toggle button (sun/moon icon)
Current date displayed in header (format: 'January 17, 2026')
Header is sticky (position: sticky, top: 0)
Clicking tabs switches visible view/section (only active view shown)
Active tab visually indicated (underline or background change)
Touch targets minimum 44px Ã— 44px
Verify in browser: header sticky, tabs switch views, responsive on mobile

userStories.title: Data Storage Layer
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a robust data storage module so that all financial data persists between sessions.
acceptanceCriteria: Create scripts/storage.js with Storage module
Define income categories: Salary, Freelance, Investment, Other
Define expense categories: Housing, Food, Transport, Entertainment, Healthcare, Shopping, Bills, Other
Implement CRUD operations: create, read, update, delete for transactions, budgets, and goals
All data stored in localStorage with JSON serialization
Unique ID generation for each record (timestamp-based)
Data loads automatically on page refresh
Verify: Add transaction via console, refresh page, transaction still exists

userStories.title: Sample Data Generator
userStories.description: As a developer, I need sample data to test the application without manually entering transactions.
acceptanceCriteria: Create loadSampleData() function in storage.js
Generate at least 20 transactions spanning last 6 months
Include mix of income (Salary, Freelance) and expense transactions across all categories
Generate 3-4 sample budgets for expense categories
Generate 2-3 sample savings goals
Function only loads data if localStorage is empty (prevent duplicates)
Verify: Clear localStorage, reload page, sample data appears

userStories.title: Add Transaction Modal - Structure
userStories.description: As a user, I want a modal form to add new transactions so that I can record my income and expenses.
acceptanceCriteria: Modal HTML structure in index.html with overlay backdrop
Modal opens when 'Add Transaction' button clicked
Close button (X) in modal header closes modal
Click outside modal (on backdrop) closes modal
Escape key closes modal
Modal hidden by default (display: none or hidden class)
Verify in browser: modal opens/closes correctly

userStories.title: Add Transaction Modal - Form
userStories.description: As a user, I want to fill out transaction details in the modal form.
acceptanceCriteria: Form fields: type (income/expense radio buttons), amount (number input), category (dropdown), date (date picker), description (text input), tags (text input)
Category dropdown shows income categories when 'income' selected
Category dropdown shows expense categories when 'expense' selected
Date field defaults to today's date
Amount validation: must be positive number, show error if invalid
Category required: show error if not selected
Submit button saves transaction to storage and closes modal
Form resets after successful save
Verify in browser: validation shows errors, transaction saves correctly

userStories.title: Transaction List View
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see all my transactions in a list so that I can review my financial activity.
acceptanceCriteria: Transactions view/tab shows list of all transactions
Display columns: date, description, category, amount
Amount color-coded: green (#4CAF50) for income, red (#F44336) for expenses
Transactions sorted by date, newest first
Transaction count displayed: 'Showing X transactions'
Empty state message when no transactions: 'No transactions yet. Add your first transaction!'
Verify in browser: transactions display correctly, sorted by date

userStories.title: Transaction Edit and Delete
userStories.description: As a user, I want to edit or delete transactions so that I can correct mistakes.
acceptanceCriteria: Each transaction row has Edit button (pencil icon)
Each transaction row has Delete button (trash icon)
Edit opens modal pre-filled with transaction data
Editing transaction updates it in storage
Delete shows confirmation dialog before removing
Delete removes transaction from storage and updates list
Verify in browser: edit updates transaction, delete removes with confirmation

userStories.title: Dashboard Summary Cards
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see summary cards showing my financial overview for the current month.
acceptanceCriteria: Four summary cards in grid layout on Dashboard view
Card 1: 'Total Income' - sum of income for current month (green)
Card 2: 'Total Expenses' - sum of expenses for current month (red)
Card 3: 'Net Savings' - income minus expenses (blue)
Card 4: 'Savings Rate' - (net savings / income) Ã— 100 as percentage (purple)
Handle edge case: 0 income shows 0% savings rate (not NaN)
Numbers formatted with currency symbol ($) and thousands separator
Verify in browser: numbers calculate correctly from transactions

userStories.title: Summary Cards Real-time Updates
userStories.description: As a user, I want summary cards to update immediately when transactions change.
acceptanceCriteria: Cards update when new transaction is added
Cards update when transaction is edited
Cards update when transaction is deleted
No page refresh required for updates
Each card has an icon (use emoji or Unicode: ðŸ’° ðŸ“ˆ ðŸ“‰ ðŸ· %)
Verify in browser: add/edit/delete transaction, cards update instantly

userStories.title: Expense by Category Chart
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see a pie chart of my expenses by category so that I can understand where my money goes.
acceptanceCriteria: Doughnut chart rendered using Chart.js on Dashboard
Shows expense breakdown by category for current month
Only categories with expenses > 0 are shown
Each category has distinct color
Hover tooltip shows: category name, amount, and percentage
Legend displayed below chart with category names
Empty state if no expenses: display message instead of chart
Verify in browser: chart renders, hover shows tooltips

userStories.title: Income vs Expenses Timeline Chart
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see a timeline chart comparing income and expenses over the last 6 months.
acceptanceCriteria: Line chart rendered using Chart.js on Dashboard
Shows data for last 6 months including current month
Two lines: income (green #4CAF50) and expenses (red #F44336)
X-axis: month names (e.g., 'Aug', 'Sep', 'Oct', 'Nov', 'Dec', 'Jan')
Y-axis: amount in currency, auto-scaled
Tooltip on hover shows exact values for both lines
Legend indicating income vs expenses
Handle months with no data: show as 0
Verify in browser: chart displays 6 months, lines visible, hover works

userStories.title: Charts Update on Data Change
userStories.description: As a user, I want charts to update when transaction data changes.
acceptanceCriteria: Expense category chart updates when transactions added/edited/deleted
Timeline chart updates when transactions added/edited/deleted
Charts responsive to container width (resize on window resize)
Smooth chart animations on update
Verify in browser: add transaction, both charts update without refresh

userStories.title: Transaction Filters - Type and Category
userStories.description: As a user, I want to filter transactions by type and category.
acceptanceCriteria: Filter section above transaction list
Filter by type: dropdown with 'All', 'Income', 'Expense'
Filter by category: dropdown populated with all categories
Filters apply immediately on selection (no submit button needed)
Status text: 'Showing X of Y transactions'
Empty result: show message 'No transactions match your filters'
Verify in browser: type and category filters work correctly

userStories.title: Transaction Filters - Date and Search
userStories.description: As a user, I want to filter transactions by date range and search by description.
acceptanceCriteria: Filter by date range: start date and end date pickers
Search by description: text input with instant filtering (on keyup, debounced 300ms)
Search is case-insensitive
'Clear Filters' button resets all filters to default
All filters work combined (multiple filters at once)
Filters persist in view until cleared

userStories.title: Monthly Budget Setup
userStories.description: As a user, I want to set monthly budgets for expense categories.
acceptanceCriteria: Budgets view/tab accessible from navigation
'Add Budget' button opens form/modal
Budget form: category dropdown (expense categories only), monthly limit (number input)
Only one budget per category allowed (show error if duplicate attempted)
Budget saves to storage
Display list of all budgets with: category name, budgeted amount
Edit and Delete buttons for each budget
Delete requires confirmation

userStories.title: Budget Progress Tracking
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see how much I've spent against each budget.
acceptanceCriteria: Each budget shows: spent amount calculated from current month transactions in that category
Progress bar for each budget: shows spent/budgeted ratio
Progress bar color: green (<80%), yellow (80-99%), red (â‰¥100%)

Verify in browser: progress bars show correct percentages, colors update

userStories.title: Budget Alerts
userStories.description: As a user, I want visual alerts when I approach or exceed my budgets.
acceptanceCriteria: Warning indicator (yellow/orange) when spending reaches 80% of budget
Alert indicator (red) when spending reaches 100% or more
Icon or badge on budget item showing warning/alert status
Summary card on Dashboard: 'Categories Over Budget' with count

userStories.title: Savings Goals Setup
userStories.description: As a user, I want to create savings goals to track progress toward financial objectives.
acceptanceCriteria: Goals view/tab accessible from navigation
'Add Goal' button opens form/modal
Goal form fields: name (text), target amount (number), current amount (number, default 0), target date (date picker), category (dropdown)
Goal categories: Emergency Fund, Vacation, Car, House, Other

Edit and Delete buttons for each goal

userStories.title: Goal Progress Display
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see visual progress for each savings goal.

Days remaining countdown calculated from today to target date
'Add Contribution' button for each goal
Contribution modal: amount input, adds to current amount
Progress updates after contribution added

userStories.title: Goal Status Tracking
userStories.description: As a user, I want visual indicators showing if I'm on track to meet my goals.
acceptanceCriteria: Status color coding: Green (on track), Yellow (at risk: 10-30% behind), Red (behind: >30%)
On track calculated by: current progress â‰¥ expected progress based on time elapsed
'Required monthly contribution' displayed: (target - current) / months remaining
Handle edge case: past target date shows 'Overdue' status
Status badge visible on each goal card
Verify in browser: status calculates correctly based on time and progress

userStories.title: Goal Completion Celebration
userStories.description: As a user, I want a celebration animation when I complete a savings goal.
acceptanceCriteria: Celebration animation triggers when goal reaches 100%
Animation: confetti effect, checkmark animation, or success modal

userStories.title: Export to CSV
userStories.description: As a user, I want to export my transactions and budgets to CSV files.
acceptanceCriteria: 'Export Transactions' button in Transactions view
'Export Budgets' button in Budgets view

Budgets CSV columns: Category, Budget Limit, Spent, Remaining

userStories.title: Import from CSV - File Upload

acceptanceCriteria: 'Import Transactions' button in Transactions view

Preview shows all columns from CSV

Light mode: white background, dark text

All touch targets minimum 44px Ã— 44px

userStories.title: Statistics - Top Spending Categories
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see which categories I spend the most on.

Categories ordered by amount (highest first)
